definition[0]: a system or process that a company has and which it will use if something goes seriously wrong, for example if it loses large amounts of data from its computer system
example[0]: We need to increase the budget allocation for disaster recovery.
definition[1]: the process of repairing a computer system that has stopped working completely or has been badly damaged by a storm, fire, or other sudden accident
example[1]: It is not unusual for an enterprise to spend 25% of its information technology budget on disaster recovery.
